data.meta_description: Free Essay: The realistic fiction book, Tangerine by Edward Bloor describes a dysfunctional family with secrets that will change everything forever. Edward...
data.text: Erik and Dad can only see the Erik Fisher’s Football Dream and not that Paul is good at soccer. “ For a while, he tried to get me to hike the ball to them. But I never really cooperated, and they soon dropped me from the routine” (30). Paul can now see that Dad and Erik are stuck in the Erik Fisher Football Dream and that if you were not in it you were noticed. This makes Paul feel like he does not belong. It shows Paul that Dad likes Erik more and focuses on him way more. When he goes over to Tino and Theresa’s house and sees how they act towards each other he learns how a family is supposed to act. “My daddy and Uncle Charlie are out in the Cleopatra grove startin a fire. They’re gonna call us out to haul tires and brush. Luis is gonna stay in the new grove and run the pump. He’s gonna call us to chop ice off the trees.” Paul can see that Tino and his family work as a team to get something done. They also support each other in whatever they want to do. Paul sees how families act around each other and how his family is so different. Paul can see through the truth and lies his parents spoon fed him. “‘We wanted to find a way to keep you from hating your brother.’ I answered, ‘So you figured it would be better if I just hated myself?’” (256) Paul sees that his parents and his brother lied to him basically his whole life. He can now see everything that has been covered up for years and years. Paul is able to confront Erik and his parents. He sees right through his parents phony excuse and makes them think about what they have been doing to him. All of the lies that his parents and Erik tell him are uncovered.
